intro: Securidaca orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco Securidaca, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. The Orinoco Securidaca is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks.
